attributes.action: better commemorate those who have been awarded the Victoria Cross and the George Cross.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The VC is awarded to servicemen who conduct staggeringly heroic actions for their country and for their comrades in arms.

The GC is awarded for ordinary members of the public for similar acts of selfless bravery, but away from the battlefield.

The time is surely come to create a national memorial accessible to all. A well-considered design, such as that which stands outside the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, could prove a much loved and symbolic statue, depicting the poignancy of war as well as selfless courage. The challenge then becomes to create something appropriate to these times.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "better commemorate those who have been awarded the Victoria Cross and the George Cross."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
